"Frame your own success: Instead of focusing on the accomplishments of others, try to focus on your own progress and celebrate your own successes. Remember that everyone has their own unique journey and path, and that comparing yourself to others can be counterproductive."

"Frame your own perspective: When you start to feel jealous, try to shift your perspective and focus on the positive aspects of your own life. Remember that everyone has their own strengths and weaknesses, and that comparing yourself to others can lead to feelings of inadequacy and dissatisfaction."

"Frame your own challenges: Instead of focusing on the accomplishments of others, try to focus on the challenges you face and work towards overcoming them. Remember that every obstacle is an opportunity for growth and learning, and that comparing yourself to others can lead to feelings of hopelessness and discouragement."

"Frame your own journey: When you start to feel jealous, try to focus on your own journey and the progress you have made. Remember that everyone has their own unique path, and that comparing yourself to others can lead to feelings of frustration and resentment."

"Frame your own goals: Instead of focusing on the accomplishments of others, try to focus on your own goals and work towards achieving them. Remember that everyone has their own unique aspirations, and that comparing yourself to others can lead to feelings of inadequacy and disappointment."
